When confronted by the Mirror, he said: “You’ve come a long way. Thank you but I can’t say anything” Green, facing calls to be stripped of his knighthood, flew to the state in his poundmillion Gulfsteam jet. He owns a pound.million home there. He played tennis for  minutes, but only got one set in between phone calls as the #MeToo scandal swirled around him. The Mirror confronted the shamed tycoon amid the fallout of him being outed in Parliament trying to gag a newspaper. When askedhis accusers were making their claims up, he replied: “I can’t say anything for legal reasons.” He then sped off in his luxury golf cart.  Green, , is facing calls to drop his injunction preventing reporting of a string of gagging orders signed by former staff, who allege he bullied and sexually and racially harassed them. Three months after he launched a pound, legal bid to silence the , Green insisted: “I categorically and wholly deny these allegations”. Sweltering in C heat, Green wiped sweat from his brow as he lunged for the ball against a man in his s. The billionaire, a keen tennis player, owns a pound.million bolt hole a stone’s throw from the courts, which are in the grounds of the Canyon Ranch Wellness Resort. It is thought he also flew there in the wake of the BHS scandal in . A source said: “Whenever troubled has flared, he has been known to head to Tucson, leaving behind his place in Monaco or his yachts.”  Meanwhile, the Mirror unearthed a picture of the Topshop boss with his arm around the waist of a young woman in little more than lingerie and angel wings. The Las Vegas photo reveals the tycoon in a frilly shirt fancy dress outfit unbuttoned to the waist, before his name was dragged into a string of scandals. It was allegedly taken in the Bellagio Hotel on Halloween in . An onlooker told the Mirror: “It was early evening when I saw Sir Philip leaving the Bellagio with two young women. “It was Halloween and everyone dresses up in America, so it seemed normal. He was clearly off to a shy and got into a car. “There was no sign of Lady Green. He was holding this woman close and clearly enjoying himself.” Before we tracked him down, the Mirror spotted the tycoon’s poundmillion jet parked discreetly at Tucson International Airport in Arizona. Green was seen talking on his mobile as he strolled in the US state.  A source said: “It’s no secret, Phil’s love of Arizona. He gushes about the place. It allows him to escape the stresses of his business. The Gulfstream GER had left Las Vegas on Sunday destined for the Arizona city, but as it was making its approach it erted to Los Angeles. Little more than  hours later, at .am on Monday, it left LAX to make the -minute journey to Tucson. The aircraft is described as the “holy grail of private jets”, flying non-stop from Hong Kong to New York. Green, often snapped with A-listers including supermodels, actors and music stars, has a transport collection that also includes a speedboat, a helicopter and other yachts. It is thought he came to Canyon Ranch amid the BHS scandal. In  he sold the chain to investors with no retail experience. A year later it fell apart with , job losses and a poundmillion pension black hole. Yesterday the #MeToo scandal continued to swirl around Green, with a hashtag of pinknotgreen swept social media. It called for a boycott of Green’s shops, including Dorothy Perkins, Wallis and Burton. On Thursday, former Labour minister Peter Hain told the House of Lords it was his “duty” to name Green due to the “serious and repeated” nature of allegations. The peer said it was “the right thing to do”. Parliamentary privilege protects MPs or peers from being prosecuted over statements made in the Commons or Lords. Green said after Lord Hain named him: “I am not commenting on anything that has happened in court or was said in Parliament today. “To the extent that it is suggested I have been guilty of unlawful sexual or racist behaviour, I categorically and wholly deny these allegations. “These settlements are confidential so I cannot comment further.” Thespent eight months investigating accusations against the tycoon. But on Tuesday it was prevented from revealing the existence of non-disclosure deals by a interim injunction issued by the Court of Appeal. Women and Equalities Select Committee chair Maria Miller, who has called for reform of such deals, suggested it was time to “consider whether NDAs are actually outlawed”. She added: “Unfortunately they’ve become so misused that some feel they can do anything as long as they can afford to pay for the victims’ silence, and that is no way for our legal system to work.”

story: NewsPrincess Dianas pernicious lies that drove Prince Charles to tearsAn explosive new royal biography about The Duke of Cornwall sheds fresh light on his troubled relationship with Princess DianaShareCommentsByTom DavidsonOnline Reporter:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video moment-prince-charles-rolls-eyes-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailPrince Charles was driven to tears by pernicious lies he blamed on Princess Diana, claims an explosive new royal biography. The book, Charles at : Thoughts, Hopes and Dreams, claims that not only did a -year-old Diana want to pull out of the  wedding - but Prince Charles did too. Royal correspondent Robert Jobson, who has written the book, claims the prince knew within just a few meetings that the pair were ill-suited. Not just that but the -year-old told friends in the weeks up to the wedding that the more time he spent with her, the more he realised he was making a mistake but neither felt they could back out. He now admits he did not get to know Diana well enough - they met no more than  times - before their engagement in February .  But his sorrow is tinged with anger at the lies he believes Diana or someone close to her peddled about him to the Press to paint him in a bad light. Someone close to Diana lived hand-to-mouth with the Press An impeccable source for the book told Robert Jobson that there were unbelievable and pernicious lies aided and abetted by somebody rather close to me  who he believes lived hand-to-mouth with the Press. The biography claims the the most hurtful lie in the princes eyes was the story he had secreted the then-unmarried Diana on board the Royal Train for a tryst. Prince Charles has always insisted there is no truth to it.  There was no tryst on the royal train The most extraordinary and pernicious of these, Charles told a close friend  is that first of all I secreted Diana on board the royal train. The story, which circulated in November , three months before their engagement, caused a furore and is thought to have prompted the Duke of Edinburgh to write to Prince Charles urging him to wed or leave Diana. Diana herself was shocked when the story broke - she had been miles away in bed - and reportedly left her wonderingthe prince had been with another woman   The following month Dianas mother Frances Shand Kydd wrote a letter to The Times protesting about the lies and harassment that her daughter had been forced to endure. The story is entirely , the prince insists and it irritates the heir to the throne even now as its publication convinced him that he needed to propose in order to protect Lady Dianas honour. Further twisting of the story in the years to come would see the tryst with Diana replaced with a secret rendezvous with Camilla - also untrue. Camilla was not smuggled into Buckingham Palace on his wedding night And there was no truth that Camilla - now the Duchess of Cornwall - was smuggled into Buckingham Palace the night before his wedding to Diana on July  . He told a friend: The idea that this could have happened and that I could have done any such thing is beyond belief, and yet this monstrous nonsense has persisted.  Other stories which he labels either a lie or an invention are claims Camilla was pelted with bread rolls by shoppers in a store in Chippenham, Wiltshire. Bread rolls thrown at Camilla in Chippingham It was in  that the BBC enraged the Prince of Wales when a story online called Camilla the woman who has in the past suffered such indignities as having bread rolls thrown at her by Diana fans. The story was regurgitated in The Dailysix years later and every time it is repeated Prince Charles is riled.  The truth is that it was a media exercise which involved actresses throwing bread rolls at one another, with a lookalike actress employed. Charles has also railed against the image of him being so pampered that he had toothpaste squeezed onto the brush for him. Toothpaste squeezed onto brush for him At a royal dinner one night Robert Jobson was sat next to Michael Fawcett, the Princes former valet and supposed toothpaste squeezer. The story is not true, said Mr Fawcett, and it still irks Charles.

story: NewsQueen to stand aside at  allowing Charles to reign as regent in just three yearsThe Queen promised to serve her country for the rest of her le - but it has long been speculated that Prince Charles could reign as a regent sooner than expectedShareCommentsByAbigail OLeary:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsThe Queen and Prince Charles at a state banquet in Buckingham Palace "Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Queen could stand aside at  allowing Charles to reign as regent in just three years time, according to an explosive new biography. On her coronation in , the Queen promised to serve her country for the rest of her le. But it has long been speculated that Prince Charles could reign as a regent sooner than expected. Now, in revelations in a new book by veteran royal correspondent Robert Jobson, its suggested the Queen could pass on her duties as monarch when she reaches , reports Mail Online . Earlier this year, Charles was appointed the Queens successor as Head of the Commonwealth - currently made up of fty-three sovereign states.  In a speech at Buckingham Palace to leaders of the commonwealth, the Queen said: It is my sincere wish that the Commonwealth will continue to offer stability and continuity to future generations, and will decide that one day the Prince of Wales should carry on the important work started by my father in . The royal familys has had one famous abdication - that of Edward VIII, the Queens Uncle. His stepping down from the throne was one of the biggest scandals to ever hit the royal family, with the Queens father George V becoming monarch. Despite rumours of the Queen stepping back, royal commentator Richard Fitziwilliams told Express the abdication of the -year-old monarch’s uncle Edward VIII “haunted” the royal family and Elizabeth II remains committed to her duty to the nation. He said although Charles’s “whole le has been a preparation for kingship”, the Queen will want succession to occur “naturally.  Other revelations in the new royal biography include details on Charless alleged worries about marrying Princess Diana and how he knew it was a massive mistake. The future king, , has revealed he let himself, Diana and the Royal Family down by going ahead with the doomed wedding despite his overwhelming doubts - which at one point reduced him to tears. The brutal bombshell was dropped by Robert Jobson, a royal reporter for nearly three decades, who has spent  months accompanying Charles on official tours around the world and has now written a book on the prince.  Charles spent  years married to Diana. He proposed on February , , but Diana felt it was like a call to duty. They wed at St Pauls Cathedral in London on July ,  and orced on August ,  - a year before the princess died . According to Jobson, alarm bells began to ring for Charles about Diana during the few meetings they had before tying the knot. He apparently realised they were not compatible when she burst into tears and would stare blankly at him when he spoke of what he had done during the day.  The more he saw of Diana, the more the prince knew in his heart he had made a terrible mistake, Jobson wrote in the Daily Mail , which is serialising the new biography. The author also claims the prince found Dianas alarming and irrational mood swings and temper impossible to deal with. Charles is said to have told pals: I desperately wanted to get out of the wedding in , when during the engagement I discovered just how awful the prospects were, having had no chance whatsoever to get to know Diana beforehand. But despite his overwhelming doubts and cold feet, Charles went ahead with the wedding - watched by  million. The decision is something he still regrets to this day and he has agonised over it for years, Jobson came to discover following conversations with the prince, people close to him, and inside sources.

story: NewsopinionRachael Bletchly: Loving le  Pass it on and join the organ donor registerMax’s Law will make it a little easier for doctors to have those ­agonising conversationsShareCommentsByRachael Bletchly:,  OCT NewsopinionHeulwen Ebsworth with young daughters including Rhian"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailI share a desk with a colleague, Rhian, who I’ve come to know well through daily conversations. But this week I was moved to tears by an article I had no idea she was writing about her mother. Heulwen Ebsworth, a beautul, vibrant -year-old, died suddenly from a brain —aneurysm in  when her three daughters were still teenagers. “When the doctors asked us about donating my mum’s shyorgans, all I could feel was fury,” wrote Rhian, who was then just . “It was the most painful moment of my le.” Heulwen wasn’t registered as an organ donor but her shyfamily knew she would want to help others and agreed.  A few months ago Rhian shydecided to find outanyone had benefited. She discovered her mother had saved six lives, including a five-year-old boy. And that knowledge will comfort her forever. “I had no idea,” I said after reading the piece. “Well, it’s not something that comes up in conversation,” she replied. And that is why Rhian told her story. Because to help save more lives we all need to talk to our loved ones about organ donation. On Friday, MP’s voted to change the law so that adults will be shypresumed to be donors unless they expressly opt out. Max’s Law – named after ten-year-old heart transplant recipient Max Johnson, who led a Daily Mirror campaign – could save shyanother  people a year. But it has to pass through the House of Lords and won’t come into effect until spring . And because shyfamilies will still be consulted before shyorgans are removed it’s vital that our next of kin know our wishes. I’d like to donate my shyorgans when I’m gone.  But, I’m ashamed to say, I’d never got round to doing shyanything about it. Thankfully though, I was visiting my shybrother when I came across Rhian’s shyremarkable article. He and I read it together and we had a chat about our choices. Then I went online and joined the organ donor register. But Max’s Law will make it a little easier for doctors to have those shyagonising conversations. And for families, like Rhian’s to pass a beautul, vibrant le to six other people.

title: salisbury cathedral part new axis
story: NewsopinionIs Salisbury Cathedral part of a new Axis of Evil That spire seems to have an awful lot to answer forShareCommentsByFleet Street FoxColumnist:,  OCT Newsopinion"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIran did a deal. Iraq got bombed back to the Stone Age. North Korea was invited to tea. Into the void where the Axis of Evil once terried the world, a new existential threat to civilisation has been born. And it has a spire  metres tall. Unbeknown to the , tourists who visit it each year, it seems that Salisbury Cathedral is built on an inter-dimensional whirlpool which sucks evil down towards hell like sand in an hour-glass. The presence of these unwitting pilgrims, walking widdershins around the cloisters, merely speeds up the spiritual centruge.Hence the bemusement of Russian spies who, on an entirely-heterosexual visit under  names to the East End of London, found themselves dragged towards the bewitching building. They broke free of its unearthly tractor beam only when they dropped a bottle of perfume that Ruslan had bought as a gt for his mother, and was unfortunately past its sell-by date.Caught in the Salisbury swirl, the liquid mutated into a battlefield nerve agent with unforeseen deadly consequences when it was dropped on the doorstep of a building that happened to be home to a Russian defector. They didnt get to see the spire. Which is a shame, because theyd heard it was the tallest in Britain.  The vortex is felt across the world. It drew a team of  assassins from Riyadh to Istanbul, where CCTV was disabled when an unfortunate journalist tripped and fell over a discarded bone saw, several times, and then cut off his own face and thew it down a well. It also compelled his accidental murderers to flee before the Turkish authorities could persuade them to headbutt a bullet, develop a sexual attraction to mincers, or perhaps most suicidally of all, announce they were taking up careers as journalists.The evil eddy even forced an otherwise-gentle and liberal soul entirely in tune with st century social norms to scream UGLY BLACK B******! at a Windrush migrant.The more cynical corners of the internet have whispered that Ryanair flights are the twisted children of Salisburys malevolent maelstrom, producing miniaturised tides of despair and misery, but the companys official ouija board insists in the face of all the evidence that it is just a coincidence.  Now it appears Salisburys undertow to the underworld has drawn someone all the way into the cathedral itself, there to smash two holes in the specially-toughened glass box in which lies one of only  remaining original copies of the Magna Carta.At time of writing no-one has been charged in relation to the Get Carta incident, but there are three madcap theories of who could be responsible:. A grammarist insistent on adding the definite article to the documents customary description, becausethe is written on the bloody thing people cant not use it . The ruler of a nation in political crisis who wants to add a th clause stating Brexit means Brexit on the basisthey didnt know what it meant in the th century she cannot be blamed for making it up as she goes along in the st . Nicholas Cage on one of his many flights of fancy, trying to crack a hidden medieval code that links the Founding Fathers to Jesus secret lovechild, whose ultimate descendant turns out to be Indiana Jones dad.  Of course, thats all ridiculous, isnt it  As mad as finding someone in Old Sarum wants planning permission for an underground shark tank, or that Kim Jong Un has moved his embassy to Middle Wallop. Or genuinely thinking that because both Porton Down and a village called Palestine are in the vicinity, Salisbury must be on speed-dial to the Devil himself. There are no forces of evil. Salisbury is no more be a wormhole to the netherworld than it is a coral atoll in the South Pacic. Whoever tried to steal the Magna Carta was too dumb to realise it was alarmed, it would disentegrate within  minutes and would be harder to sell on than Philip Greens used undercrackers. Evil is a supernatural force which means some people are born beyond redemption - destined for corruption and amorality, and liablecaught to be crucied, electried, poisoned or shot because theyre something other than human. But evil is just an excuse.Humans are merely bad. They make bad decisions and do bad things, making bad excuses along the way. Vladimir Putin ordered the elaborately-dficult murder of Sergei Skripal because he thought the defector was evil, and evil deserves the effort. The Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia ordered the elaborately-messy murder of Jamal Kashoggi for the same reason. And people like the Ryanair racist arent evil, either. Theyre angry, ignorant, unsocialised outcasts, often sick and usually screaming at the world for not being nicer to them. When we say something is evil we refuse to take responsibility. We say it was out of our hands when the Twin Towers fell or the policeman was kned or the terrorists got through. We dont say: How did we make that terrorist  Why dont we spend money on people who do bad stuff  What has to change before we accept that guy other there goes to the toilet just like I do Whoever tried to steal the Magna Carta, whoever is sending bombs to Donald Trumps enemies, whoever strokes Tommy Robinsons cancerous ego is not evil. Theyre us, with a few things gone wrong. A lost job, a last straw, a loose wire.If we stop saying its evil -we stop saying maybe thats just Salisbury for you - we might be able to fix it. You dont solve problems with an excuse.

title: sir philip green snapped las
story: NewsPhilip Green snap alongside scantily clad Vegas showgirl emerges as billionaire hides in Arizona boltholeEXCLUSIVE: The picture, obtained by the Mirror and taken in Las Vegas, reveals the billionaire in his pomp before his name was dragged into a string of scandalsShareByNick SommerladChristopher BucktinNicola Bartlett:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsPhilip Green with his arm round a woman at a casino in Las Vegas"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailWith his trademark grin, Sir Philip Green wraps his arm around the waist of a young woman in little more than lingerie and angel wings. The picture, obtained by the Mirror and taken in Las Vegas, reveals the billionaire in his pomp before his name was dragged into a string of scandals. As we today tracked down Green to Arizona, there were demands for the tycoon to be stripped of his knighthood. He is facing calls to drop his injunction preventing reporting of a string of gagging orders signed by former staff, who allege he bullied and sexually and racially harassed them. Three months after he launched a pound, legal bid to silence the , Green issued a statement this week in which he insisted: “I categorically and wholly deny these allegations”.  The Las Vegas photograph shows Green wearing one of his much-loved fancy dress outfits, a frilly shirt unbuttoned to the waist, with the unidentied young woman at his side. It was allegedly taken in the Bellagio Hotel on Halloween in . An onlooker told the Mirror: “It was early evening when I saw Sir Philip leaving the Bellagio with two young women. “It was Halloween and everyone dresses up in America, so it seemed normal. He was clearly off to aand got into a car. “There was no sign of Lady Green. He was holding this woman close and clearly enjoying himself.”  Tonight Green appeared to be lying low after being named in Parliament as the businessman behind the injunction. The Mirror spotted the Topshop tycoon’s poundmillion private jet parked discreetly at Tucson International Airport in Arizona. Green was seen talking on his mobile as he strolled in the US state.A source said: “It’s no secret Phil’s love of Arizona. He gushes about the place.  “It has year-round sun and allows him to escape the stresses of his business. “Whenever troubled has flared before he has been known to head to Tucson, leaving behind his place in Monaco or his yachts.Normally where ever his Gulfstream is, Phil is not far away.” The Gulfstream GER had left Las Vegas on Sunday destined for the Arizona city, but as it was making its approach it erted to Los Angeles.  Little more than  hours later, at .am on Monday, it left LAX to make the -minute journey to Tucson. Green’s aircraft is described as the “holy grail of private jets”. It can fly non-stop from Hong Kong to New York. It was delivered in , weeks before the Green family’s Lionheart superyacht arrived.The vessel is understood to have cost poundmillion. Green, often snapped with A-listers such as the late Dirty Dancing actor Patrick Swayze, has a transport collection that also includes a speedboat, a helicopter and other yachts.  He is a regular in Tucson, where he visits the Canyon Ranch wellness resort at the foot of Santa Catalina Mountains. It thought he used the retreat during the BHS scandal. In  he sold the chain to investors with no retail experience. A year later it went to the wall with , job losses and a poundmillion pension fund black hole. Meanwhile the #MeToo scandal continued to swirl around Green today. A hashtag of pinknotgreen swept across social media, with calls for a boycott of Green’s shops, including Dorothy Perkins, Wallis and Burton.On Thursday, ex-Labour minister Peter Hain told the House of Lords he felt it was his “duty” to name Green due to the “serious and repeated” nature of allegations. He told Parliament he had “been contacted by someone intimately involved in the case of a powerful businessman using non-disclosure agreements and substantial payments to conceal the truth about serious and repeated sexual harassment, racist abuse and bullying”. A barrister claimed Lord Hain’s conduct was “completely improper”, but the peer said it was “the right thing to do”. He later told BBC Newsnight: “I considered it extremely seriously before I said it. I’m discharging myas a parliamentarian, and what concerned me about this case was wealth, and power that comes with it, and abuse.”  Parliamentary privilege protects MPs or peers from being prosecuted over statements made in the Commons or Lords. Green said after Lord Hain named him: “I am not commenting on anything that has happened in court or was said in Parliament today. “To the extent that it is suggested that I have been guilty of unlawful sexual or racist behaviour, I categorically and wholly deny these allegations. “These settlements are confidential so I cannot comment further on them.” Thespent eight months investigating accusations against the tycoon. But on Tuesday the newspaper was prevented from revealing the existence of non-disclosure deals by a interim injunction issued by the Court of Appeal. Women and Equalities Select Committee chair Maria Miller, who has called for reform of such deals, today suggested it was time to “consider whether NDAs are actually outlawed”. She added: “Unfortunately they’ve become so misused that some feel they can do anything as long as they can afford to pay for the victims’ silence, and that is no way for our legal system to work.”

title: student seen struggling stand hours
story: NewsStudent seen struggling to stand hours before death at boozy university initiation where he downed  vodkasEdward Farmer, , had been taking part in an Agricultural Society initiation event in December , where he may have had up to  shots of vodka in less than three hoursShareCommentsByAbigail OLearyHannah Graham:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video cctv-captures-ed-farmers-final-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA student was captured on CCTV struggling to stand hours before he died at a boozy university initiation ceremony. Edward Farmer, from Leicestershire, had been taking part in an Agricultural Society initiation event in December , where he had up to  shots of vodka in less than three hours. The -year-old, a Newcastle University Fresher, died due to the toxic effects of an excessive amount of alcohol in a short period of time, according to an inquest. Edwards death sent shockwaves through the university, which has now banned initiation ceremonies, reports ChronicleLive . The ceremonies are often carried out when freshers join a new society and usually involve drinking large quantities of alcohol. At Newcastle University, most students ChronicleLive approached had heard about the Mr Farmers death, and have seen stories about the inquest over recent days. All agree that it is shocking - one calls the story terrying.  One man said his flatmate is a member of the Agricultural Society, the group which organised the initiation which ended in Mr Farmers death. Theyve all been warned about it, he said. Music student Holly Clarke said it had been a shock to hear about the tragedy, which didnt line up with her experience at university at all. I honestly thought it was an American thing that happened in frat houses there, or maybe at Oxbridge - it doesnt seem like something that would have happened here, she said. I havent experienced anything like it. Its terrying that something like that could happen. Drink and death with students, it feels completely unheard of, and the fact that it was through an initiation process worries me. I think part of it is that with new students theres this idea that youve got to go out and get drunk, thats part of the culture, and thats not just Newcastle. People are being inserted into a new environment, they want to fit in and make friends and the way they do that is by drinking - freshers are socially expected to drink a lot. Newcastle University officially bans initiations to its student societies. The university website warns anyone found to have organised or participated in an initiation ritual will be subject to disciplinary action, saying the events encourage excessive drinking, force humiliating and degrading behavior, and may bring the institution into disrepute.  Speaking at the inquest, however, Lesley Braiden, academic registrar at Newcastle University, said it was dficult,not impossible, to monitor initiation events. The group of lads who met with the Chronicle, who admit to having some experience of initiations, therefore ask to remain anonymous. Now studying for masters degrees, most of them completed their undergraduate at Newcastle, when several of them participated in the events as freshers. However, they said they dont recognise some of the more shocking challenges mentioned in Mr Farmers inquest - apple bobbing in urine or drinking from a pigs head - and they dont think the initiations are a more general problem for the university. One man said: A lot of sport societies have initiations, a lot of first years get excessively drunk and do silly challenges. What happened is awful - when someone gets to that stage thats when you stop and make sure theyre alright. But the way its being portrayed makes it sound like its a problem with our student culture in general. Its being made into a bit of a witch-hunt against Newcastle and societies. You cant say its completely safe, but when students take part, theyre  and they choose to do it. You might be egged on but youre not forced to drink. The group listed the activities theyd think of as being involved in initiations, saying it is mostly drinking games, and some times tasting unpleasant non-alcoholic things. Youd pour spirits into a football boot and drink them, or do shots of something thats a bit disgusting, one said. When asked about the university ban on initiations, the students were only vaguely aware of it.  A third man said: You get emails, but I dont think anybody is really going to listen to it - theyd just call them something . While these students admitted to having experienced initiations, and one witness at Mr Farmers inquest said they were widespread, most of those wandering around campus who agreed to speak said it was not something theyd come across. Fourth year chemical engineering student Jono Morley said: I havent experienced anything like that. I think its just sports teams, although Ive got friends on sports teams whove never done anything like that. He agreed there was a culture of heavy drinking more generally, but not more so than in other universities or cities. I would say most students here are the same as at any other university: its just students being students. For third year psychology student Charlotte White, this drinking culture felt alienating as a fresher - so she started up the Newcastle University Sober Socials society. Teetotal Charlotte was keen to take part in activities which didnt centre around drinking, but found most of the activities organised by university clubs seemed to involve going out. She founded the society, now in its second year, for drinkers and non-drinkers alike who wanted a club whose social activities didnt focus on boozing. The really friendly group go out for coffee, bowling, or host sober film nights. I tried to find societies I could feel comfortable in but a lot of them would only offer club nights, she said. In Freshers Week they do put on some non-drinking events but after that its just sort of expected thatyou want to socialise you go out drinking.  People are expected even before they go to uni to drink a lot as freshers - family members would say to me oh, Newcastle, theres great night le there so theres a sense you have to take advantage of that. There can be a pressure to drink: a lot of friends have come to me and said I wish I could say no but they feel likethey want to go and make friends they have to pretend they are really up for it. The -year-old, who is also studying drinking culture in universities as part of her academic work, says that pressure can also extend to the amount drunk: theres a sense that students should not just drink, but get drunk. People say oh, Ill come out for one but friends say have another, Ill buy you one, evenyoure trying to control it and be sensible it doesnt happen. Theyre trying to make sure everyone has fun, but that means drinking. Newcastle University registrar, Dr John Hogan, said: Ed’s death was a great tragedy which shocked us all and we would once again like to express our deepest condolences to his family and friends. Initiations are banned at Newcastle University and it is made clear to all clubs and societies that any such events constitute serious misconduct.  Since Ed’s death we have already made a number of changes to the way we raise awareness among our students about the risks of alcohol and how they keep themselves and their fellow students safe. However, having listened to the evidence we will be reflecting carefully on all that we have learnt at the inquest and looking at whether there are areas where we can improve what we do. Over the last four days we have been shocked to hear some of the details of what took place that night and do not condone this sort of behaviour in any way. Following our disciplinary investigations a number of students were found to be in breach of University rules and appropriate inidual sanctions were imposed. The Students’ Union also took action against the society involved. The welfare and safety of all our students are of paramount importance to us and together with the Students’ Union we work hard to help them stay safe during their time at university. On behalf of the University, I would once again like to express to Ed’s family and loved ones our deepest sorrow about the loss of a young man of such potential who surely had a bright future ahead of him.

title: pipe bomb suspect cesar sayoc
story: NewsPipe bomb suspect Cesar Sayoc once promised explosion worse than   as twisted past unearthedThe -year-old former stripper railed against Democrats like Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama, writing vitriolic posts onlineShareByNatalie EvansUS Editor Joseph Ax:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news world-news video suspect-charged-connection--mail-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailSuspected MAGA bomber Cesar Sayoc previously threatened to bomb an energy company after they tried to shut off his electricity. The -year-old, who is accused of sending pipe bombs to critics of President Donald Trump, warned the power company it would be worse than September th, according to a  police report. His extensive rap sheet also includes arrests for domestic violence, theft and fraud. Sayoc, a former stripper, showed flashes of violent anger and posted vitriolic screeds online. In recent months, Sayoc, a registered Republican, railed against Democrats like Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama on Facebook.  He also posted venomous broadsides against George Soros on Twitter, posting one tweet on Wednesday, two days after he allegedly mailed a bomb to the liberal philanthropists home. Hours after he was arrested in Plantation, Florida, on Friday, his social media posts and peripatetic work history began to offer the first sketch of a man whose rudimentary bombs launched a nationwide manhunt. Sayoc has been charged by the FBI after  explosives were sent to top Democrats including the Clintons and Obamas. He is accused of five federal crimes, the U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions confirmed tonight during a press conference. He faces up to  years in prisonfound guilty.  Sayocs white van, which was seized by authorities, had numerous pro-Trump stickers featuring the President and Vice President Mike Pence, as well as a CNN SUCKS sign. The van also had photos of Clinton and other Democrats with bullseyes superimposed on their faces.  David Cypkin, , a documentary filmmaker, recalled seeing the van parked outside a shopping center near his home for more than a year and as recently as this summer. It often had an open door or an open window, which led me believe there was somebody inside, Cypkin said in a phone interview. It stayed overnight. I saw it dozens of times.  Sayocs social media accounts are filled with anti-Democrat sentiments and racist diatribes. Two Twitter accounts that appear to belong to Sayoc are largely made up of retweeted posts condemning prominent Democrats, including Andrew Gillum, the Democratic candidate for Florida governor, and Soros. Two weeks ago, Sayoc threatened a former Democratic congressional spokeswoman on Twitter after her appearance on Fox News. The tweet warned her to hug your loved ones real close every time you leave home.  The woman, Rochelle Ritchie, reported him to Twitter, but the company found he had not violated any conduct rules. A Twitter spokeswoman declined to comment, citing an ongoing law enforcement investigation. A Facebook profile that appeared to belong to Sayoc featured videos and photos of him at multiple Trump rallies, including at least one in Florida. Several posts contained anti-Muslim statements.  Sayoc attended Bred College in North Carolina and the University of North Carolina in Charlotte and played soccer for both schools, though he did not graduate either one, according to school representatives. From  to , he worked as a male exotic dancer for Gold Productions Inc, according to a company employee. Sayoc left to pursue a professional wrestling career and later started his own company. He is a promoter, booking agent and live entertainment owner, according to his LinkedIn profile. He filed for bankruptcy in Miami in , according to court records. At the time, Sayoc said he lived with his mother and had recently left a store manager job that paid less than , a year. He listed a , tax refund and a  Chevy Tahoe vehicle as his only assets.  His LinkedIn page said he was pursuing veterinary medicine at High Point University in North Carolina, but a school spokesman said he did not attend the school. One of his Twitter accounts said he worked at the Seminole Hard Rock Hotel  Casino in Florida, but the Seminole Tribe of Florida, which owns the casino, said it could find no evidence to confirm that.  FBI director, Christopher Wray, announced that  explosive devices had been sent to iniduals. Sayocs fingerprints were found on a package sent to congresswoman Maxine Waters, Wray said. And he didnt rule out there being other packages. But he added: We do believe weve got the right guy. The FBI tweeted: The FBI can confirm we have one person in custody. There will be a press conference in Washington DC at the Department of Justice at :pm ET.  The explosive devices were sent to top Democrats, former senior US officials and prominent critics of President Donald Trump. Trump this afternoon praised the FBI for finding the suspect and compared it to a needle in a haystack job. He said: I am pleased to inform you that law enforcement has apprehended the suspect and taken him into custody. Its an incredible job by law enforcement. These terrorising acts are despicable and have no place in our country. And we will prosecute them, him, her, whoever it may be to the fullest extent of the law. He went on to say how Americans must uny and show the world they are united in peace and harmony. It comes as police found two suspicious packages earlier today addressed to US Senator Cory Booker and James Clapper, the former US director of national intelligence.  All the people targeted have often been maligned by right-wing critics. They included Democratic Party donor George Soros, former President Barack Obama, former Vice President Joe Biden, and former Secretary of State and presidential candidate Hillary Clinton. The Federal Bureau of Investigation has said that at least five of the packages bore aaddress from the Florida office of US Representative Debbie Wasserman Schultz, a former chair of the Democratic National Committee. There has been an outcry from Trumps critics, who claimed that his inflammatory rhetoric against Democrats and the press has created a climate for politically motivated violence.  After first calling for unity and civil discourse on Wednesday, Trump lashed out again Thursday at the hateful media. His supporters accused Democrats of unfairly suggesting the president was to blame for the bomb scare. Funny how lowly rated CNN, and others, can criticize me at will, even blaming me for the current spate of Bombs and ridiculously comparing this to September th and the Oklahoma City bombing, yet when I criticize them they go wild and scream, its just not Presidential! Trump said on Twitter.  Authorities believe the packages, which were intercepted before reaching their intended recipients, all went through the US Postal Service at some point, a source said. None detonated and no one has been hurt. The devices were thought to have been fashioned from bomb-making designs widely available on the internet, a federal law enforcement source told Reuters. Still, investigators are treating the devices as live explosives, not a hoax, said James ONeill, the New York City police commissioner. Investigators have declined to say whether the devices were built to be al. Bomb experts and security analysts say that based on their rudimentary construction it appeared they were more likely designed to sow fear rather than to kill.  The parcels each consisted of a manila envelope with a bubble-wrap interior containing potentially destructive devices, the FBI said. Each was affixed with a computer-printed address label and six US Forever postage stamps, the agency said. Two packages were sent both to Waters and Biden. Others who received the bombs were former Attorney General Eric Holder, former CIA director John Brennan, US Representative Maxine Waters of Calornia, and actor Robert De Niro. I thank God no ones been hurt, and I thank the brave and resourceful security and law enforcement people for protecting us, De Niro said in a statement. Theres something more powerful than bombs, and thats your vote. People MUST vote!

story: NewsWoman horried to discover her photo being used as the before image in a weight loss advertA woman who makes parody photos for Instagram was shocked when she found out her pictures were being used to promote "body shaming"ShareCommentsByCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  OCT NewsCeleste is used to sharing her photos - but she never expected one of them to be used like this "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailActress and comedian Celeste Barber loves posting weird and wonderful photos online. title: hapless st bernard dog left
story: NewsHapless St Bernard dog left with face full of quills after trying to befriend porcupineRuckus had a run-in with the prickly customer in New YorkShareCommentsByMark Chandler:,  OCT NewsRuckus was left regretting his encounter "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA hapless St Bernard dog was left with a face full of painful quills after trying to befriend a porcupine. The unfortunate pooch, called Ruckus, has a history of trying to play with the prickly animals. But he came off worse this time, with hundreds of porcupine spines embedded in his face, nose and mouth. Shocked vets at the Lollypop Farm animal shelter had to painstakingly remove each one. And, incredibly, the animal has now made a full recovery from his encounter. A spokesman for the shelter said: Ruckus was surrendered to Lollypop Farm so that he could receive treatment for the quills that were stuck into his jowls, face, and inside of his mouth. His previous owners indicated that Ruckus had an unfortunate history of going after porcupines. Ruckus wasn’t the first, and won’t be the last pup to lose a fight with a porcupine.  Porcupines can have more than , quills and will release them into the face of a potential threat. The shelter said: Ruckus was treated by the veterinary team here at Lollypop Farm, who quickly worked to detach the quills from around and inside of his mouth. The tips of porcupine quills that puncture the skin are actually shaped like a tiny fish hook, and can be very dficult to remove. Luckily for Ruckus, our team was able to safety remove all of the quills, and this big pup was feeling better in no time at all. The huge hound now has a new owner too after being adopted by a local dog-lover.

title: passageway underworld found beneath mexicos
story: NewsPassageway to the underworld found beneath Mexicos Pyramid of the MoonArchaeologists say a secret tunnel beneath the ancient landmark could contain a treasure trove of deformed remains and artactsShareCommentsByMark Chandler:,  OCT NewsThe Pyramid of the Moon where the new tunnel was discovered "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA tunnel found hidden beneath one of Mexicos ancient pyramids could have been used as a passageway to the underworld, experts say. The secret corridor, leading to a chamber beneath the Pyramid of the Moon at Teotihuacaacuten, has been discovered by archaeologists. They say it was probably used for rituals relating to the underworld and a treasure trove of human remains along with strange artacts could be found inside. The tunnel,  feet beneath the ancient ruins, was initially made following a scan of the area last year. And investigators from the National Institute of Anthropology and History said the ritual space may have simulated travelling into the underworld after death.Veronica Ortega, the director of the Project of Integral Conservation of Plaza de la Luna, said this week: Previous explorations found skeletons of iniduals with cranial deformation, as in the Mayan area, and erse green stone objects . So it is not dficult to think that something similar could be found in the subsoil.  The tunnel is located to the south of the Plaza de la Luna, but it is likely that there is another entrance to the east side. He said investigations into the tunnel and cavity could also reveal the pyramids links to other regions, MailOnline reported. Dr Ortega said: Whats found inside could help to unravel the relationships that this ancient metropolis had with other regions of Mesoamerica.  Scans were made using electric resistivity, a radical technique which creates an image of the subsurface. The tunnel was found towards the south of the Plaza de la Luna - a central square believed to have been used for human sacrices in front of crowds of up to ,. And experts now believe there could be another entry to the east.  The Temple of the Moon is the second-largest temple in Teotihuacan, after the Temple of the Sun. Its structure existed prior to  AD, experts say, while the city of Teotihuacan is thought to date back to around  BCE. In ancient times, Teotihuacan become one of the largest ancient settlements in the Americas with at least , inhabitants.Built by a pre-Columbian civilisation it was eventually occupied by the Aztecs. But, despite extensive study of the area, archaeologists have never been able to find the remains of any of the citys rulers.

title: callum booth keen to keep feelgood factor going at dundee united
story: Callum Booth is delighted to see everyone associated with Dundee United pulling in the same direction and he’s determined to reward today’s travelling support with more to cheer at Dunfermline.The Tangerines head to East End Park today for new manager Robbie Neilson’s third match in charge.Despite only being in charge for a couple of weeks now, United left-back Booth says the new gaffer has already made quite an impression.He said: “It’s been brilliant, really good. Training has been really good and I thinkyou asked any of the boys in the changing-room we’d all be the same.“It’s really gone up a level, we’re all enjoying it and I think that shows on a Saturday.“It’s been quite tough but I think we needed that. It’s been enjoyable at the same time, though, and we’re all buying into his ideas.”Off the field there seems to be an air of optimism around Tannadice but Booth knows getting results on the pitch is the only way to realise their hopes of promotion.And that means keeping their unbeaten run under the new boss going against a Dunfermline side that have already bagged a deserved win over the Tangerines.Booth added: “Four points from the first two games isn’t too bad but I think they were two good performances as well.“We feel hard done by we didn’t get the win over Inverness – I think most people there would agree with that but it wasn’t to be.“At least we put in a really positive performance and everyone is pulling in the same direction.“There is a good feel about the place and, hopefully, we can kick on now and go on a little run.“The players, coaching staff, fans all seem to be pulling in the same direction especially since the new gaffer has come in.“A thousand fans down at Partick, great backing and then same again last weekend. The fans were right with us until the last minute.“It does help, it makes a massive dference and Dunfermline isn’t too far down the road so I’d expect another good away following.“I think the fans can see the work and effort we’re putting in, evenwe didn’t get the three points last Saturday.“The fans have been great and long may it continue.”Allan Johnston’s Pars have been struggling of late after a lightning fast start to the season saw them follow up four wins from four in the Betfred Cup group stage with an impressive - victory at Tannadice.Since then, Dunfermline have only managed eight points from the following eight games and were beaten - at home last weekend despite dominating against Queen of the South.In fact, scoring goals at home has been a real problem of late with just the two Championship strikes going in.Booth  Co., however, are wary of a repeat show from the Pars.He said: “Dunfermline were really good at Tannadice the first time we played them and thoroughly deserved to win.“I think most people would be surprised they’ve not kicked on from that first game.“They played well that day and deserved the win.“I’ve not seen much of them since but it’s not worked out for them since for whatever reason.“They’ll still be a dangerous opponent, though, because they are, obviously, capable of putting in a performance but have just been a bit inconsistent recently.“If we go about it like we have done in the last two games then we’ll give ourselves a chance.“We’ll be going there in positive spirits, try to take our chances and come back up the road with the three points.”

title: dundee appoint jimmy boyle as new assistant manager
story: Dundee have appointed Jimmy Boyle as assistant manager to Jim McIntyre.The -year-old steps up from his post as head of the Dark Blues youth academy to team up with the new boss who arrived to succeed Neil McCann last week.Jimmy has been in the dugout for the games against Livingston and Hearts and confirmation he’s to remain their permanently brings to an end the Billy Dodds saga that’s dragged on since the new manager arrived last week.Dodds, who was Jim’s number two at Ross County, was his first choice for the same post at Dens Park, but well documented matters relating to his departure after Dundee went into administration in  made him unacceptable to many Dark Blues fans.As well as him, it’s understood Dens legend Barry Smith and Aberdeen coach Barry Robson were also being considered.But Jim has opted for another man he knows well and who has extensive experience in coaching and management.The pair played together at Airdrie and during eight years with the Diamonds, Jimmy appeared in two Scottish Cup finals.After a career that included spells at a string of clubs including Queen’s Park, Livingston and Partick Thistle, he was Airdrie’s under- coach for several seasons before succeeding Kenny Black as manager in .He was sacked three years later, but was quickly appointed to the SFA’s coaching staff and in  was headhunted by Dundee to take charge of developing their emerging talent.Over the last two-and-half-years he’s transformed the fortunes of the club’s underage sides and last season saw him steer the Development squad to a second place finish in their league.Known for someone who prefers to stay out of the limelight, he has been persuaded to make the step back up to first team level and assist his old team-mate in keeping Dundee in the Premiership.A Dundee FC statement said: #Jimmy has been with the club since joining as head of youth development in . During that period he has overseen the academy while also managing the development side and helping out with the first team.

title: dundee bins could be overflowing this christmas if bin collectors go ahead with strike
story: Dundee residents could be left with overflowing bins at Christmasrefuse workers decide to strike in a row over pay. vw, px"  Union representatives for the city’s bin collectors have confirmed they are prepared to take industrial action during the festive period in protest at a below-inflation wage offer.Meanwhile, union bosses for all council workers, including social care staff, said they too were prepared to cause “maximum disruption” to services over their pay claim.Unite has already rejected a % pay offer from the Convention of Scottish Local Authoritiesand both Unison and the GMB are recommending members reject the deal. Ballots on the offer close next month.George Barr, local convener of Unite’s environmental ision, said that feelings were running high.“If necessary we’ll be recommending to our members that they take strike action over the pay claim,” he said.“We believe Christmas would be the time strike action would have the most effect.“It would make bosses sit up and listenbins weren’t being emptied at that time of year.“We will wait to see the result of the other ballots but we are confident they too will reject the % offer.”Helen Meldrum of GMB Scotland, which represents city council workers, said members are ready to walk out. She added: “We are ready to take action that would create maximum disruption.“For us this, would mean action by social care workers in the city.”Jim Macfarlane of Unison said: “We would co-ordinate industrial action with the other unions across all aspects of council work to have the maximum impact.”A spokesman for Cosla said: “The offer on the table is the best in the public sector in Scotland and we would urge employees to recognise this and vote to accept the deal and with a bit of luck we can have it in their pay packets for Christmas.”

title: dundee bridal shop shuts down after a quarter of a century in business
story: A Dundee boutique which has been selling dresses to brides-to-be for more than two decades has closed its doors for the final time.Bows and Bells has ceased trading from its premises on the Cowgate.A note on the door of the store confirmed the premises is permanently closed.In a statement posted online, a spokeswoman for the firm said it was with “much sadness” that the decision had been taken to shut the shop.The spokeswoman added: “Many thanks again to all our past customers. It’s been a pleasure.”Bows and Bells – which also operates from another premises in Kirkcaldy – had been selling bridal wear from its city centre store for  years.One trader who works at a store nearby said he had seen items being removed from the premises in the last few weeks.He added that he was “disappointed” to hear of the shop’s closure.The Tele attempted to contact Bows and Bells but was unable to reach anyone.At this stage, it is unclear what the future holds for the now-vacant premises.Bilal Turgul, , owner of Efes Cafe Bistro on the Cowgate, said he feels the area has been “neglected” in recent years.He said: “This side of Dundee is terrible. There just isn’t enough trade.“I’ve been here for the past four years and in that time I’ve noticed a decline.“I feel this side of the city has been neglected.”But Kirsty Bennett, a hairdresser at neighbouring dHair on St Andrew’s Street, disagreed – and said she believes it has enjoyed a resurgence.Describing the area as a “great location”, she said: “The area is definitely on the up.“We’ve got the new flats coming in at the bottom of the street and there is also the coffee shop on the corner.“The building is in a great location.“I hope it will be filled soon.”

title: dundee linked with move for ex ross county and dundee united defender
story: Another former Ross County player could be on Jim McIntyre’s radar.It emerged on Wednesday, Martin Woods has been training with Dundee and could be the new Dens Park boss’ first signing.And now there’s speculation defender Paul Quinn could also join up.Like Woods, Quinn played under Jim up in Dingwall. The -year-old moved to Dundee United last year but his appearances were limited by injury and illness.And he would have to prove his fitness before being given a contract with the Dark Blues.Meanwhile, the matter of who will be the new assistant boss at Dundee could be resolved soon.Billy Dodds is the manager’s preferred choice but as is now clear his arrival would be unpopular with many fans.Others in the frame include Aberdeen coach Barry Robson and possibly even former Dee skipper, and one-time manager, Barry Smith.Whoever gets the nod should be in place for next week’s clash with Celtic.

title: dundee to be trial for national scheme to tackle obesity
story: Dundee is set to pilot a national fat-busting scheme which aims to cut childhood obesity by half by .The Scottish Government is providing funding to health bodies in Tayside to address the region’s high number of people who are overweight or obese.About % of men and % of women in the region are either overweight or obese, according to the results of the Scottish Health Survey published last month.Dr Drew Walker, director of public health at NHS Tayside, is urging the board to tackle obesity as a matter of priority because of its links to other conditions such as heart disease and type  diabetes.He said: “The single biggest threat to the sustainability of health services is obesity.“We need to tackle it as it is right down the middle of everything we’re doing in the coming months and years.“The environment we live in discourages us from taking exercise and eating healthy and we need to change that.”The pilot project in Dundee – part of a national strategy to put Scotland on a slimming diet – will look in particular at tackling the area’s issues with obesity among children.Research by the Tele has found the proportion of P-age kids in Dundee who are obese could be as high as % – the Tayside average is %.The plan will involve the health board, together with local bodies, working on encouraging healthy lestyles from cradle to grave, with an aim of halving childhood obesity by the end of the next decade.An average of , new cases of type  diabetes are diagnosed in Tayside each year which could be avoided with a healthier lestyle.Among ministers’ proposals are plans to cut multi-buy offers on unhealthy snacks, improving healthy offerings in school and hospital canteens and educating parents on how to feed their kids a healthy diet.The outcome of the project in Dundee and the wider Tayside area will then help to inform future approaches where in Scotland as part of the national strategy.NHS diet consultant Joyce Thompson said that being an early adopter of the scheme was a “fantastic opportunity” to improve the health of youngsters across the region.Ministers have given NHS Tayside £, of funding this year in order to kickstart the scheme. The money will increase to £. million over the course of five years.

title: dundee united is perfect platform for striker pavol safranko
story: Robbie Neilson says Dundee United are giving star striker Pavol Safranko the perfect  to show off his ability.The Slovakian international joined the Tangerines on loan while former boss Csaba Laszlo was still in charge to regain the form that saw Aalborg shell out a six-figure sum last summer.The move to Denmark hasn’t worked out but four goals in his last five games during his loan spell at Tannadice has helped new boss Robbie get off to a positive start with a win and a draw in his first two games.And the new United gaffer is delighted he’s got a player like Safranko to lead the line, evenhe accepts the Slovakian is likely to only be a one-season wonder.He said: “I’ve been very impressed with Pavol, very impressed. He’s definitely one of our key players.“He links the game well, has good strength, very good mobility and a good attitude as well – the rest of the players really like him as well which is a big thing.“You need a striker to lead the line for you that can handle the physicality because the game gets like that in Scotland.“Last Saturday there were a few hefty challenges but he stood up to it. I have been impressed, I think he’s a very good player.“He got a good move before but has had a dficult time since.“However, we’ve given him a  to rebuild himself and I think it’s a good window for him to show what he can do.”Neilson has also revealed he’s upped the tempo in training since taking the reins to get the best out of his new squad.He added: “We have just been trying to get the intensity up in training a wee bit.“When I came in, I looked at all the data at what they had done previously and what I felt I would try to implement because I have dferent ideas about what to do.“I just felt we needed to do something a wee bit dferent to try to get a spark in the team and get some enjoyment.“What you want to do when you come in is work them really, really hard to get them as fit as you can as quick as you can. But you also have to realise where their base is so you can minimise injuries.“We have been pretty lucky with that with only Paul Watson getting a wee tweak in his thigh last week.“The base was good, it was fine and I was happy with it but I just wanted to bring more intensity to training to make it shorter and sharper.”

title: dundee united women on the road to the top after league win
story: Dundee United Women are already looking ahead to next season after clinching the Scottish Women’s Football League One title at Tannadice Park after an emphatic victory over Cove Rangers.It was the first time the United girls had played an official match on Tannadice itself and it turned out to be extra special with silverware presented at the end of a - win.Captain Keira Johnstone said: “I am massively proud of the girls and what we have achieved.“It was a big day for us and the team performed brilliantly.“Everyone has worked hard, players and coaches, to gain promotion to the Scottish Women’s Premier League . We can’t wait to get started next season.”Head coach Gavin Beith added: “To finish the season off the way we did was very pleasing and doing this at Tannadice made it such a special day for everyone involved.“On and off the park so many people have worked extremely hard over the years to support the team and it’s a fitting way to cap off a good season.“Playing SWPL football is going to be exciting for us all.”Paul Wilson, the Community Coaching Manager, commented: “I’m delighted. The girls were excellent.#They handled the pressure of playing at Tannadice and rose to the challenge. They pulled together and the crowd of  really got behind them.”The United girls won , drew three and lost one of their  league games with a goal dference of plus .

title: eyesore dundee office block could be converted into rehabilitation gym
story: An eyesore building could get a new lease of lefunding can be found to turn it into a rehabilitation gym.The block at Luna Place in Dundee’s Technology Park is covered in graffiti, with broken windows and rubbish giving it such a derelict appearance, councillors were pushing for legal action to force the owner to clean it up.Dundee woman Valerie Duguid hopes to transform the neglected space into a gym for people recovering from serious illnesses such as cancer and stroke. She needs £, to launch the facility – called Gymology – and is appealing to businesses and organisations to help with funding.Valerie, who already runs therapeutic exercise classes around Tayside with the help of volunteers, said: “We have planned everything, right down to the logo. However, we need £,.“We are looking at taking on the building that’s been such an eyesore and turning it into something amazing. This won’t just be a gym, but also a training facility, where we will train fitness instructors to work with people with chronic illnesses. We really need the people of Dundee to get behind us.”As well as gym equipment, the facility will have therapeutic artwork and a social enterprise cafe.Gymology already has a “shop front” at the David Lloyd gym in Monieth and a Facebook page.

title: following years of decline business leaders hail renaissance of dundee street
story: Business leaders have hailed “a renaissance on Reform Street” as the area continues to transform its fortunes following years of decline.The thoroughfare was once one of the city’s most successful commercial streets but was forced to contend with a general trend away from high street shopping and a series of notable closures leaving units empty.By , there were almost as many empty shopfronts as thriving businesses on the street and city planners faced serious questions over its future.But with a host of leading travel publications backing the City of Discovery, business is beginning to pick up, and Reform Street traders say they are feeling optimistic.Derrick Thames, one of four owners of the cafe chain Blend, which recently moved into the street, said business had been booming.He said: “We did look at premises by the Waterfront, but we really like this street.”“It’s got a great feel to it and we hope this is the beginning of a renaissance. I think there is a lot of potential with Dundee.”A number businesses have joined Blend in choosing Reform Street, including German Doner Kebab, Project Pizza, Fat Burger and Asian fusion restaurant Dai Pai.Alison Henderson, CEO of Dundee and Angus Chamber of Commerce, said Reform Street was “on the up”, and it has been “very positive” to see so much investment.She said: “The occupancy levels are stronger, there are good signs of businesses investing, the activities such as the young people from The Shore with their art project – all these things definitely add up to an increased vibrancy.“There have been lots of organised city centre activities which help bring footfall, from the design festival pop-up shop to farmers markets in the City Square and lots of engaging activity at The McManus.

title: kilmarnock submit complaint to sfa over referee chiefs letter to dundee fans over jordan jones dive
story: Kilmarnock have submitted a formal complaint to the Scottish Football Association after referee chief John Fleming claimed Jordan Jones had ed against Dundee.The Northern Ireland winger agreed to accept a two-match ban after he was charged with simulation following his side’s win at Dens Park.However, the Rugby Park outfit made it clear their player had not acted in a premeditated manner when he won his side a controversial spot-kick, insisting the only reason they had not challenged the punishment was a lack of supporting TV evidence.Fleming has angered Killie bosses after he wrote to a Dundee fans group saying Jones of threw himself to the ground “solely to deceive the referee”.In his letter to the Dundee Supporters’ Association , which was revealed by the Tele, Fleming stated: “The two-match suspension offered to the player has been accepted by the club which, in my opinion, clearly indicates the player committed an act of simulation during the match. On accepting the two-match suspension, the club, in my opinion, are accepting the player committed the act, solely to deceive the referee.”However, that has enraged Kilmarnock, who released a statement which read: “The original correspondence from the DSA to the SFA and Mr Fleming expressing concern over the suitability of Steven McLean to take charge of Kilmarnock matches was completely baseless and cast unfounded aspersions on the referee’s character.“It is highly ironic that after another organisation has cast aspersions on the integrity of a match official, it is our club which has been the subject of negative remarks.”Dundee fans# group writes to top officials over referee Steven McLean#s links to Kilmarnock" src"https:www.eveningtelegraph fp dundee-fans-group-writes-to-top-officials-over-referee-steven-mcleans-links-to-kilmarnock embed # secretfpZWClsvb" data-secret"fpZWClsvb" width"" "" title"#Dundee fans# group writes to top officials over referee Steven McLean#s links to Kilmarnock# # Evening " frameborder"" marginwidth"" margin"" scrolling"no"

title: local singer horse returns to dundee for show
story: FIFE singer-songwriter Horse McDonald willto Dundee next year.It has been announced that the singer will perform at the city’s Rep Theatre on June  .The new date next year was announced only a few months after her show at the same venue back in May.Horse, who was born in Newport-on-Tay, is a regular visitor to the City of Discovery and is considered to be one of Scotland’s most successful female solo artists.In her over-two-decade career, Horse has opened for and toured with some of the most famous artists in the music industry including Tina Turner, BB King, Bryan Ferry and Burt Bacharach.Tickets for the show are available from dundeerep.Doors open at .pm.

title: new midfielder could figure for dundee in celtic clash
story: Boss Jim McIntyre could have more selection options available when his team face champions Celtic at Dens Park on Wednesday.However, he’ll still have at least a couple of men out injured.Full-back Nathan Ralph and centre-half Genseric Kusunga were not ready to face Hearts on Tuesday evening.Both, though, have been back in training this week and that could put them in contention for a place against the Hoops next midweek.Midfielder Martin Woods, who’s been training at Dens this week, could also be handed a contract in time for involvement in the next outing.However, the likes of Paul McGowan and Josh Meekings are expected to remain on the sidelines as they continue their battles to get back fit after y absences.The club are expected to announce McIntyre’s assistant later today.

title: run run rudolph hundreds of santas set for second dundee dash
story: It’s already become a highlight of Dundee’s festive season.And organisers are ho-ho-hoping that the second annual Santa Dash will attract even more support.Hundreds of people dressed in red suits will soon take to the streets to raise money for a very worthwhile cause.Furniture and carpet company Gillies has been announced as the official sponsor of the event, which is also backed by the Eveningand Wave FM.The Santa Dash s to the city on December  and will again raise money for The Archie Foundation, the official charity of Tayside Children’s Hospital in Dundee.Garry Smith, events and promotions officer for organisers Leisure and Culture Dundee, said: “The Archie Foundation helps everyone in the city.“Everyone knows a kid that has been helped at some point by the children’s hospital.“It’s such a worthwhile cause – and this year we’re hoping to get about , Santas – last year we had .”It is hoped the event will raise at least £, for The Archie Foundation this year, having raised £, last year.The race will follow a km route through the city centre, starting and finishing in City Square.Garry added: “It’s a great way of raising money and a great cause. The atmosphere is amazing.“You can walk, run or jump. Some kids have been on skateboards before and many wheelchair users will be taking part.”The Archie Foundation’s Tayside Appeal is aiming to raise £ million for a new children’s operating theatre suite.Director of communications Linda Isles said: “We’re delighted that we have been chosen again this year – we’re beyond chuffed.“We’re hoping even more people will sign up this year. It worked really well for us last year.“Everyone had a great time because the weather was great and the atmosphere was fabulous.”Gillies started supporting The Archie Foundation in  when the store raised funds for the charity through a Christmas shop window display.Managing director Ian Philp is also the Tayside Fundraising Committee chairman of The Archie Foundation.Ewan Philp, marketing director at Gillies, said: “Every year we choose one charity for our Christmas display.“The display is for kids and The Archie Foundation supports children, so we thought the two would go hand in hand.“We’re going to enter a team this year and we’ll also be helping out with registration.”Ewan said the Santa Dash is a particularly special event because it’s something that the whole family can enjoy.He added: “It’s all really good fun and it’s a family-friendly event as well.“You can push a buggy or you can bring your dog along.“The Archie Foundation is a good charity to support because it keeps funds local.“It also helps sick children in Tayside at a time when they probably need it the most – Christmas.”Bookings can be made online or in person at Central Library, Olympia or Dundee Ice Arena where Santa suits can be collected right away.For more details go to leisureandculturedundee santadash.

title: vip tickets to les miserables being auctioned at charity fashion show in dundee
story: VIP tickets for the opening night of Sir Cameron Mackintosh’s production of Les Miserables are up for auction at this year’s Shelter Scotland Fashion Show in Dundee.Organised by staff and volunteers from the charity’s shops in and around, Dundee, the auction will also feature several exclusive items.These include a five-diamond dress- ring worth £, a handbag by Radley and limited edition artwork.This year’s event is already on track to be the charity’s biggest yet in the city and is timed to mark the organisation’s th anniversary.The Les Mis production donated the tickets for the show when the UK tour reaches Edinburgh in January.They will give the top bidder the best seats in the house at the Festival Theatre and access to the cast party.The diamond ring was donated by Henderson the jewellers.Entrance to the Shelter Scotland Fashion Show costs £ and includes a light buffet with tea or coffee, a glass of prosecco and cake.Doors to the event at the Queen’s Hotel at  Nethergate open at .pm.John Sinclair, area manager for Shelter Scotland’s shops in the north of Scotland, said: “We are so grateful to Sir Cameron Mackintosh, Henderson the jewellers and all the other people and businesses who have donated items to the auction.”Tickets are on sale at Shelter shops on Perth Road, Dundee, and Brook Street, Broughty Ferry.
